content: Yes, it is common for digital asset managers to have portfolios that showcase their skills, experience, and achievements in managing digital assets. A portfolio is a valuable tool for demonstrating your expertise and knowledge in digital asset management, as well as your ability to organize, manage, and preserve digital assets effectively. A portfolio can include examples of past projects, case studies, testimonials from clients or colleagues, and examples of metadata schemas or taxonomies you have created. Having a portfolio helps potential employers or clients understand your qualifications, abilities, and work style, and can provide them with confidence in your abilities as a digital asset manager.
